title: Moving charges - B-field direction for constant v

content.question:
A particle with charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></math> moves horizontally with speed <math alttext="v " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> into the region between two parallel horizontal charged plates. The upper plate has a uniformly distributed positive charge and the lower plate has a uniformly distributed negative charge of the same magnitude. A magnetic field <math alttext="B sub 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is introduced into the region between the plates such that the particle moves through the region between the plates with no change to its velocity. In a second scenario, a second particle with charge <math alttext="negative q " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></math> and a smaller mass than the first particle moves horizontally with speed <math alttext="v " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> into the same region between the plates. A magnetic field <math alttext="B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is introduced into the region between the plates such that the second particle also moves through the region between the plates with no change to its velocity. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitude and direction of <math alttext="B sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
MagnitudesDirections of <math alttext="B sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>A<math alttext="B sub 1 is greater than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Same directionB<math alttext="B sub 1 is greater than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Opposite directionsC<math alttext="B sub 1 equals B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Same directionD<math alttext="B sub 1 equals B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Opposite directions
